com.epoch.chem

Class StereoFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.chem.StereoFunctions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChemConstants, FormatConstants

    public final class StereoFunctions
extends Object
implements ChemConstants
    Contains stereoisomer generation and manipulation functions.

    • Field Summary

      • enumerateStereo

        public static Molecule[] enumerateStereo(Molecule[] initCpds)
        Converts an array of compounds with unspecified configurations at some sp3 stereocenters and double bonds into all the possible stereoisomers.
        Parameters:
        initCpds - an array of molecules that have stereocenters with unspecified configurations
        Returns:
        an array of Molecules that have all possible combinations of configurations at previously unspecified stereocenters

      • enumerateStereo

        public static List<Molecule> enumerateStereo(List<Molecule> initCpds)
        Converts a list of compounds with unspecified configurations at some sp3 stereocenters and double bonds into all the possible stereoisomers.
        Parameters:
        initCpds - a list of molecules that have stereocenters with unspecified configurations
        Returns:
        a list of Molecules that have all possible combinations of configurations at previously unspecified stereocenters

      • enumerateStereo

        public static List<Molecule> enumerateStereo(Molecule cpd)
        Generates stereoisomers of a compound with sp3 stereocenters and double bonds.
        Parameters:
        cpd - a molecule that has stereocenters and double bonds with unspecified configurations
        Returns:
        a list of stereoisomers

      • anyAreChiralNonracemic

        public static boolean anyAreChiralNonracemic(Molecule[] mols)
                                      throws MolCompareException
        Gets if any of the molecules in the array is chiral, is explicitly drawn as such, and does not have its RACEMIZE flag set to true. For example, CCC(C)O (2-butanol) would not be found to be chiral by this method, but CC[C@@H](C)O ((R)-2-butanol) would be.
        Parameters:
        mols - an array of molecules
        Returns:
        true if any of the molecules is chiral and does not have its RACEMIZE flag set to true
        Throws:
        MolCompareException - if something goes wrong in matching a mirror image to the original

      • isFlaggedRacemic

        public static boolean isFlaggedRacemic(Molecule mol)
        Gets if a molecule has been flagged as racemic.
        Parameters:
        mol - a molecule
        Returns:
        true if the molecule has been flagged as racemic

                               int setAngleDegrees)
        Sets the dihedral angle in a molecule to a given amount in integral degrees.
        Parameters:

        atomIndex - array of indices of four contiguous atoms that define a dihedral angle
        setAngleDegrees - the angle in degrees

      • rotateDihedral

        public static void rotateDihedral(Molecule molecule,
                                  int atom0Index,
                                  int atom1Index,
                                  int moveAngleDegrees)
        Rotate around a bond by the given amount. Rotation occurs about the atom0 → atom1 vector. Modifies the molecule.
        Parameters:
        molecule - a molecule
        atom0Index - index of one of the bond atoms
        atom1Index - index of the other bond atom
        moveAngleDegrees - the size of rotation in degrees

      • translateFrag

        public static void translateFrag(Molecule molecule,
                                 MolAtom atom,
                                 MolBond removeBond,
                                 DPoint3 translateVector)
        Translates a group of atoms.
        Parameters:
        molecule - molecule part of which should be translated
        atom - the atom that should be translated; its undisconnected ligands will be translated as well
        removeBond - bond whose removal will isolate the atoms to be translated from those not to be translated
        translateVector - the vector along which the atoms will be translated

      • translateFrag

                                 MolBond[] removeBonds,
                                 DPoint3 translateVector)
        Translates a group of atoms.
        Parameters:
        molecule - molecule part of which should be translated
        atom - the atom that should be translated; its undisconnected ligands will be translated as well
        removeBonds - bonds whose removal will isolate the atoms to be translated from those not to be translated
        translateVector - the vector along which the atoms will be translated

      • rotateFrag

        public static void rotateFrag(Molecule molecule,
                              MolAtom atom,
                              MolBond removeBond,
                              DPoint3 rotateVector,
                              DPoint3 rotateCenter,
                              double angle)
        Rotates a group of atoms.
        Parameters:
        molecule - molecule part of which should be rotated
        atom - the atom that should be rotated; its undisconnected ligands will be rotated as well
        removeBond - bond whose removal will isolate the atoms to be rotated from those not to be rotated
        rotateVector - the vector along which the atoms will be rotated
        rotateCenter - the point around which the atoms will be rotated
        angle - angle in radians by which the atoms will be rotated

      • rotateFrag

        public static void rotateFrag(Molecule molecule,
                              MolAtom atom,
                              MolBond[] removeBonds,
                              DPoint3 rotateVector,
                              DPoint3 rotateCenter,
                              double angle)
        Rotates a group of atoms.
        Parameters:
        molecule - molecule part of which should be rotated
        atom - the atom that should be rotated; its undisconnected ligands will be rotated as well
        removeBonds - bonds whose removal will isolate the atoms to be rotated from those not to be rotated
        rotateVector - the vector along which the atoms will be rotated
        rotateCenter - the point around which the atoms will be rotated
        angle - angle in radians by which the atoms will be rotated

        public static double getAngle(MolAtom[] angleAtoms)
        Gets the angle (in degrees) defined by three atoms.
        Parameters:
        angleAtoms - atoms A-B-C
        Returns:
        the angle in degrees (0 through 180)

      • getAngle

        public static double getAngle(MolAtom[] angleAtoms,
                              int flags)
        Gets the positive or negative angle defined by three atoms in the xy plane.
        Parameters:
        angleAtoms - atoms A-B-C
        flags - whether the response should be signed, in degrees
        Returns:
        the angle about B defined by A and C (0 through 180 or π, or -180 or -π through 180 or π)

                           double factor)
        Scales a molecule's coordinates.
        Parameters:
        molecule - molecule to be rescaled
        factor - scaling factor

      • getBondStereo

        public static int getBondStereo(MolBond bond)
        Gets a value for bond stereochemistry. Possible values:
        • 0, MolBond.UP, MolBond.DOWN, MolBond.WAVY for single bonds;
        • 0, MolBond.CIS, MolBond.TRANS, CRISSCROSS for double bonds.
        Double bonds return CRISSCROSS if mixture is indicated by wavy bond to ligand, by ligand geometry, or by criss-cross double bond.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond whose stereochemistry is being queried
        Returns:
        the stereochemistry value

      • getBondStereoFlags

        public static int getBondStereoFlags(MolBond bond)
        Gets single- or double-bond stereochemistry flags. Possible values:
        • 0, MolBond.UP, MolBond.DOWN, MolBond.WAVY for single bonds;
        • 0, CRISSCROSS for double bonds.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond whose stereochemistry is being queried
        Returns:
        the stereochemistry flags

      • setBondStereoFlags

        public static void setBondStereoFlags(MolBond bond,
                                      int stereoType)
        Sets single- or double-bond stereochemistry flags.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond whose stereochemistry is being set
        stereoType - stereochemistry flag: MolBond.UP, MolBond.DOWN, MolBond.WAVY for single bonds, CRISSCROSS for double

      • removeBondStereoFlags

        public static void removeBondStereoFlags(MolBond bond)
        Removes all single- and double-bond stereochemistry flags.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond whose stereochemistry is being removed

      • allCrissCrossToWavy

        public static void allCrissCrossToWavy(Molecule molecule)
        Converts criss-cross representation of stereorandom double bonds into wavy-bond-to-substituent representation. Modifies the original!
        Parameters:
        molecule - a molecule

      • allCrissCrossToWavy

        public static void allCrissCrossToWavy(Molecule[] mols)
        Converts criss-cross representation of stereorandom double bonds into wavy-bond-to-substituent representation. Modifies the original!
        Parameters:
        mols - array of molecules

      • allWavyToCrissCross

        public static void allWavyToCrissCross(Molecule molecule)
        Converts wavy-bond-to-substituent representation of stereorandom double bonds into criss-cross representation.
        Parameters:
        molecule - a molecule

      • checkForWedgesFromNonstereo

        public static void checkForWedgesFromNonstereo(Molecule origMol,
                                               boolean disallowSuperfluousWedges,
                                               boolean prefersJava)
                                        throws WedgeException
        Checks if the parity of a stereocenter cannot be determined from the wedge bonds or if any wedge bonds originate at nonstereogenic atoms.
        Parameters:
        origMol - molecule to check for ambiguous or unnecessary wedge bonds
        disallowSuperfluousWedges - when true, throw exception when a wedge bond originates at a nonstereogenic atom
        prefersJava - true if the user prefers using Java MarvinSketch over MarvinJS
        Throws:
        WedgeException - if there's an ambiguous or unnecessary wedge bond

      • isChiral

        public static boolean isChiral(Molecule mol)
                        throws MolCompareException
        Gets if a molecule is chiral and is explicitly drawn as such. For example, CCC(C)O (2-butanol) would not be found to be chiral by this method, but CC[C@@H](C)O ((R)-2-butanol) would be.
        Parameters:
        mol - a molecule
        Returns:
        true if the molecule is chiral
        Throws:
        MolCompareException - if something goes wrong in the matching process

      • convert0DTo2D

        public static void convert0DTo2D(Molecule cpd)
        Converts a zero-dimensional compound (no atomic coordinates) such as one produced by Reactor into a two-dimensional compound.
        Parameters:
        cpd - the compound

      • convertTo3D

        public static void convertTo3D(Molecule cpd)
        Converts a compound into three dimensions.
        Parameters:
        cpd - the compound

      • stereoClean

        public static void stereoClean(Molecule cpd)
        Fixes ambiguous stereochemistry derived from more than one wedge bond connected to a stereocenter, assuming only one wedge originates at the stereocenter. Modifies the original!
        Parameters:
        cpd - a molecule
